text:
With the gen 5 hybrid water heater, Rheem dumbed-down the UI so the customer can no longer see key diagnostic/status info like the water temperature at various levels in the tank. It would be great if these items were available in the app, but theyâ€™re not.

The app tells you even less. The hot water tank â€œavailabilityâ€ icon is useless. Itâ€™s tiny and thereâ€™s no documentation or help on what the various colors and levels mean. It may show a thin red line at the bottom. What does that mean? How much hot water is left? Any? After heating for a while, itâ€™ll show a thin blue line.  What does that mean? How much hot water is left? Then itâ€™ll show a thin green line. Same questions. Then itâ€™ll show the green level halfway up the icon. Same questions. Finally, itâ€™ll show the talk all green, even if the compressor is still running. Same questions? How am I supposed to know how much hot water is left, if I should switch the heater to High Demand or Electric mode, etc.?

Please, Rheem, if diagnostic/status info is recorded by the device and can be sent over Wi-Fi, please upgrade the app to capture and report it! That will be a vast improvement to the product.

Bug: The power usage report often shows twice as much power usage as actually occurred on a given day. Generally, thatâ€™s 1-2 kWh more that was actually consumed according to my energy monitor, which measures power drawn through the water heater breaker and, separately, the Mains. We also have a Tesla battery Gateway that measures total home power consumption. It agrees with the energy monitor. Neither sees the extra water heater usage the app is reporting. I think I know whatâ€™s going on: The app shows 0.2kWh spikes every few hours, which the energy monitor and Gateway donâ€™t see. The compressor is not turning on during these periods. If I add all the 0.2 kWh spikes for a day, the total is the same as the difference in power usage reported by the app and my monitors. So the spikes donâ€™t represent actual power draw. This bug has been reported in earlier reviews and should be fixed by now. But itâ€™s not.

From time to time, the heater controls in the app donâ€™t work. Iâ€™ll try to change the temp, but the indicator will go from orange to gray. Shortly after that the indicator will go back to orange and my temp change wonâ€™t have taken effect. Same happens sometimes when I try to change the operating mode, say from Energy Saver to High Demand. The change just doesnâ€™t take effect. Then a few minutes later I *might* find the change did take effect, as if it was delayed. This is bad because the water heater could be left in an undesired state. Itâ€™s probably a communications issue.

Finally, I had trouble getting vacation mode started. I ended up manually lowering the temp to 65F, then turning increasing the temp via the Internet early on the day we came home. Iâ€™m not sure if this problem was due to the very poor and confusing UI or a communications problem.

Bottom line, this app needs a *lot* of work. Itâ€™s simply not up to modern standards for an advanced device like the Rheem hybrid water heater.
